The Rangers insist that Dale Purinton is part of their future. However, Purinton, a 24-year-old defenseman, is obviously not in the team's current plans.
The Rangers recalled defenseman David Wilkie from the Houston Aeros of the International Hockey League yesterday and returned Purinton to Hartford of the American Hockey League.

Purinton had been recalled from a two-week conditioning program at Hartford before the Rangers' home opener Wednesday night because Vladimir Malakhov injured his left knee. When it was determined that Malakhov would miss four weeks with a sprained anterior cruciate ligament, the Rangers decided to recall the 26-year-old Wilkie. Purinton was the odd man out.
